ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] DId everyone give up EQ?
ygData.msgSnippet: Done one of those myself........too funny. Sleep well....I bet you will dream about EQ!!!!! ... === message truncated ===
ygData.messageBody:
Done one of those myself........too funny.

Sleep well....I bet you will dream about EQ!!!!!
--- Su <suceress@...> wrote:
>
> I dunno about guilds. Heh. I've been too busy
> playing EQ to post. :-)
> got my cleric to 39! whee!
> anyways, played eq aaaalll night and need to sleep
> now.
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > We had tons or threads a few weeks back and now
> > nothing. So let me throw this out........
> > I have just joined a guild and am pretty excited.
> I
> > was thinking about forming my own but was not sure
> on
> > the total procedures. So, posing some questions to
> the
> > group.......
> >
> > 1. Can you create one and recruit people and then
> when
> > you have the 10 you need, submit it for approval?
> >
> > or
> >
> > 2. So you need to recruit the 10 and have them
> listed
> > in order to even start the guild?
> >
> >
> > I have a few other questions but I will start
> another
> > thread as to leave this one for the guild stuff.
> >
> > Rob
> > --- alexander.jones@... wrote:
> > > 60.
> > >
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> > > Sent: Thursday, January 31, 2002 9:56 PM
> > > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] A random eq tip, old
> for
> > > some, new for some.
> > >
> > >
> > > Oh cool! What lvl song is that?
> > > luv,
> > > -Su
> > >
> > > > DA = Divine aura. you cant be killed and you
> cant
> > > attack, no spells land,
> > > > cant cast any spells. Untouchable for about 18
> > > secs.
> > > >
> > > > Only special attacks like deathtouches go
> through
> > > it, and it can be
> > > > dispelled.
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> > > > Sent: Thursday, January 31, 2002 9:44 PM
> > > > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > > > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] A random eq tip, old
> for
> > > some, new for some.
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Cool! I haven't participated in many raids
> yet,
> > > but that sounds like good
> > > > advice. Thanks!
> > > > What exactly does Kazumi's do?
> > > > luv,
> > > > -Su
> > > >
> > > > > As im mostly playing 60 bard heres a tip if
> you
> > > are low on wizzies on
> > > raid
> > > > > end and are having problems porting people
> out
> > > of a dungeon. This is old
> > > > for
> > > > > people in the raid a lot guilds and new for
> a
> > > few here maybe.
> > > > >
> > > > > Its the matter of druid's doing
> translocates.
> > > > >
> > > > > Heres the setup: It requires a 60 bard and a
> > > druid. Have the bard load
> > > > > "Kazumi's note of preservation" (this is a
> group
> > > da song, 3 tick
> > > > duration).
> > > > > Instruct the druid to say when he starts
> casting
> > > his port spell, have
> > > the
> > > > > bard start Kazumi immediately after druid
> > > starts. Those that want to get
> > > > > ported, click off the Kazumi's note effect
> icon
> > > (thus removing da),
> > > druid
> > > > > keeps it. All that removes da will be
> ported,
> > > rest will bounce and stay
> > > in
> > > > > zone.
> > > > >
> > > > > Rinse and repeat as many times needed to
> safely
> > > get all melees out.
> > > > (Kazumi
> > > > > has a little reload time)
> > > > >
> > > > > This will help a lot instead of having to
> > > bind/coth or whatever method
> > > you
> > > > > have to do to get enough porters.
> > > > >
> > > > > If you have any useful raiding tip - share
> it
> > > ;-)
> > > > >
> > > > > I figured it out for myself but im pretty
> sure
> > > others have found it out
> > > > > aswell, should be on some messageboard I
> guess.
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >
